contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox station | name=Greystone | logo= | logo_size= | image=Greystone train station, Yonkers, NY.jpg | image_size=300 | image_caption=View north from station overpass,<br>with local electric multiple-unit train arriving, 2011 | style=MNRR Hudson | address=61 Harriman Avenue<br>Yonkers, NY, 10701 | coordinates= | line={{rail color box|system=MNRR|line=Hudson}} | other={{bus icon|12px|Local Transit}} '''[[Bee-Line Bus System]]''': 1C, 1T, 1W | platform=2 [[side platform]]s | tracks=4 | electrified= 700[[volt|V]] ([[Direct current|DC]]) [[third rail]] | parking=250 spaces | bicycle= | passengers= | pass_year= | pass_percent= | opened= | rebuilt= | ADA=yes | code= | owned= | zone=3 | former=Harriman(1899-1910)<ref>[http://www.victoriansource.com/id39.html The Building of the Greystone section of Northwest Yonkers (formerly known as Harriman) by Harriman and Hawley in the late 1890's (VictorianSource.com)]</ref> | services={{s-rail|title=MNRR}} {{s-line|system=MNRR|line=Hudson|next=Hastings-on-Hudson|previous=Glenwood}} }} The '''Greystone''' [[Metro-North Railroad]] station serves the [[Greystone, Yonkers|Greystone]] neighborhood of [[Yonkers, New York]] via the [[Hudson Line (Metro-North)|Hudson Line]]. It is the northernmost station on the Hudson Line in Yonkers. Trains leave for [[New York City]] every 25 to 35 minutes on weekdays. It is {{convert|17.1|mi|km}} from [[Grand Central Terminal]] and travel time to Grand Central is about 41 minutes. As of August 2006, daily commuter ridership was 513 and there are 250 parking spots.<ref>{{cite news| title = Metro North Station Ridership| work =The New York Times| url = http://www.nytimes.com/packages/html/nyregion/commutemetro-north.html| accessdate = 2011-11-11}}</ref> ==History== Greystone station was originally built in 1899 by developer Charles Harriman as "Harriman Station" for the [[New York Central and Hudson River Railroad]], who insisted that he rename the station "Greystone" in 1910. A pedestrian bridge was built in 1915. As with many NYCRR stations in Westchester County, the station became a [[Penn Central]] station upon the merger between NYC and [[Pennsylvania Railroad]] in 1968, until it was taken over by [[Conrail]] in 1976, and then by [[Metro-North Railroad]] in 1983. ==Platforms and tracks== The station has two high-level [[side platform]]s, each eight cars long. The west platform next to Track 4 is generally used by southbound trains. The east platform next to Track 3 is generally used by northbound trains. The Hudson Line has four tracks here; the two inner tracks not next to either platform are used by express trains. ==References== <references/> == External links == {{commonscat-inline}} *[http://as0.mta.info/mnr/stations/station_detail.cfm?key=20 Metro-North Railroad - Greystone] *[http://as0.mta.info/mnr/mstations/station_status_display.cfm?P_AVIS_ID=104 List of upcoming train departure times and track assignments from MTA] {{coord|40.9721|-73.8896|region:US_type:railwaystation|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Greystone (Metro-North Station)}} [[Category:Metro-North Railroad stations in New York]] [[Category:Stations along New York Central Railroad lines]] [[Category:Transportation in Yonkers, New York]] [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1899]] {{NewYork-railstation-stub}}
